text: I found a bug in the HubL syntax checker

you can use {% else %} {% endif %} without the if conditional.

I had some problems with the blog template because the listing tab was displaying in the blog-post template and closing wrong the div containers so after the blog-content block the rest of block were out of the .body-container-wrapper.
After some research I found that I had an extra {% endif %} that closed my first condition and then the else was out my conditional and seems like it affected the is_listing_view HS conditional creating that overflow

Hey guys, this may be a simple answer but I'm essentially looking to incorporate a "latest posts" section on my homepage/throughout some other pages... I'd like them to show in the format they do on the blog listing template (screenshot with blue header), but only show the top two recent posts (see other screenshot "latest posts.." Can anyone direct me to the HUBL that I'll need for this? Thanks!
<@U795QFHDE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U795QFHDE/F8J10N079/screen_shot_2017-12-19_at_12.05.14_pm.png|Screen Shot 2017-12-19 at 12.05.14 PM.png>
There is HubSpot documentation for doing just that
anyone try sorting a table with the "created_at" attribute?
